com.baypackets.ase.sbb
Interface ConferenceController

All Superinterfaces:
SBB
public interface ConferenceController
extends SBB

This interface defines an object that is used to establish a conference call and control the signalling involved in adding and removing participants, terminating the call, and performing various advanced conferencing features including sidebar conferences and dialogs.

Author:
Baypackets

MODE_LISTEN_AND_TALK

Method Detail

getConferenceInfo

public ConferenceInfo getConferenceInfo()
Returns the Conference Info object associated with this conference controller.

Returns:
The Conference Info object. NULL if the conference is not yet connected or is already disconnected.

connect

public void connect(MsConferenceSpec conf,
 MediaServer mediaServer)
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
 ConnectException
This method is called to request that the media server create a control channel for managing the conferences.

Parameters:
conf - The Conference Specification.
mediaServer - The Address of the Media Server object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this controller is already in the connected state (OR) if it is explicitely invalidated.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the conference identifier specified is already in use.
ConnectException

disconect

public void disconect()
 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
 DisconnectException
Disconnects the control channel with the Media Server that is used for managing the conferences. This operation would end the conference but all the participant endpoints would still be connected to the mediaserver.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Conference is already disconnected OR it is never connected.
DisconnectException

getMediaServer

public MediaServer getMediaServer()
This method returns the address of the media server that is controlling the RTP interactions involved in providing the conference.

Returns:
The address of the connected media server or null if none is connected.

updateConference

public void updateConference(MsConferenceSpec spec)
 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
 MediaServerException
This method updates the conference parameters.

Parameters:
spec - The Conference Specification
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if conferenceId is not NULL and does not match the current conference ID.
MediaServerException - if an error occurs while initiating the update request with the media server.

join

public void join(ConferenceParticipant[] joiningParticipants,
 java.lang.String[] modes)
 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
 MediaServerException
This method joins all the specified participants to the specified conference object.

Parameters:
joiningParticipants - The list of participants joining the conference.
modes - Mode of joining this participant.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the participant does not use the same media server used by this controller.
MediaServerException - if an error occurs while initiating the join request with the media server.

unjoin

public void unjoin(ConferenceParticipant[] leavingParticipants)
 throws MediaServerException
This method makes the specified participants to leave the conference.

Parameters:
leavingParticipants - list of participants leaving the conference.
Throws:
MediaServerException - if an error occurs while initiating the unjoin request with the media server.

getParticipants

public java.util.Iterator getParticipants()
Returns all the participants belonging to this conference.

Returns:
Iterator of the current list of participants in the conference.

isActiveSpeaker

public boolean isActiveSpeaker(ConferenceParticipant participant)
Returns whether the participant is an ACTIVE speaker in this conference or not.

Parameters:
participant - The participant to be checked for active speaker or not.
Returns:
true if the participant is an active speaker in the conference, false otherwise.

play

public void play(MsPlaySpec playSpec)
 throws MediaServerException
Plays the announcement specified by the play spec to the conference.

Parameters:
playSpec - The play operation specification.
Throws:
MediaServerException - if an error occurs while initiating the play announcement request.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
Sets the timeout in seconds for the Media Server operations. If this value is not specified explicitly, then the value from the MediaServer object is used.

Parameters:
timeout - Timeout in seconds for the Media Server operations.

getTimeout

public int getTimeout()
Gets the current timeout value set.

Returns:
Timeout value in seconds.
